[/i]

cards.rules_text:
Flying
When Lustrous Devout enters, choose one —
• Put a +1/+1 counter on Lustrous Devout.
• Create a colorless artifact token named Lotus Petal with “{T}, Sacrifice this artifact: Add one mana of any color.”

When Makshi, Patron of Blades enters, search your library for an Equipment card, reveal it, put it into your hand, then shuffle. Add {W}{U}{B}{R}{G}. Spend this mana only to cast Equipment spells and activate abilities of Equipment.
cards.flavor_text:
[i]“Take pride, mortal. You've forged such lovely tools of destruction before your end.”
[/i]

cards.rules_text: Target creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn. Then draw a card if that creature is a Warrior.
cards.flavor_text:
[i]The four fighters danced around the towering god. Hadik and Rekha's spears struck from a distance while Kalemn and Helene matched Masha's crushing strength with their own.
[/i]

cards.rules_text:
First strike
When Masha Ritualist enters or whenever you cast a spell, if {B}{G} was spent to cast it, return target creature card with mana value 3 or less from a graveyard to the battlefield under your control. Put a +1/+1 counter on Masha Ritualist.

The next time you cast an instant or sorcery spell this turn, copy that spell. You may choose new targets for the copy.

Create a 1/1 blue Illusion creature token with “This gets +1/+1 for each other Illusion you control.”

Create a 1/1 blue Illusion creature token with “This gets +1/+1 for each other Illusion you control.”
Acquiesce (If you cast this spell from your hand, exile it as it resolves. When one or more creatures you control deal combat damage to an opponent, you may cast this card from exile without paying its mana cost.)

Defender

cards.flavor_text:
[i]Concepts forced themselves upon the world, folding reality around them until they became impenetrable.
[/i]

cards.rules_text:
Gestalt (When this or another creature enters under your control, you may merge it with the one in play, keeping counters and attachments. They become the permanent on top plus all abilities from under it.)
Double strike

cards.flavor_text:
[i]The scout spoke from her mount. “I spotted a pair of women just north of here. Their clothes are... foreign, but they seem normal enough.”
“If they were normal,” Hadik replied, “they wouldn't be alive.”
[/i]

cards.rules_text:

• Search your library for up to two basic land cards, reveal them, put them into your hand, then shuffle.
cards.flavor_text:
[i]That which was built will collapse. That which had bloomed will wilt. That which had created will consume.
[/i]

cards.flavor_text:
[i]“Little walker of worlds. You will hunt what we have lost, and make us whole.”
[/i]

cards.flavor_text:
[i]For some, the whispers were calm. Loving. For others, they were a reminder of all the harm they had caused, and would continue to cause.
[/i]

cards.rules_text: When Palesoul Mender dies, you gain life equal to its toughness.
cards.flavor_text:
[i]Filled with peace, her body grew faint so that her soul could shine all the brighter.
[/i]

cards.rules_text: At the beginning of each main phase, each player adds {W}{U}{B}{R}{G}.
cards.flavor_text:
[i]For centuries, the visions of the seers have let them advise their paragons with wisdom and foreknowledge. Now, those visions bring only madness.
[/i]

cards.flavor_text:
[i]From the creators came the world, and to the creators it shall return.

[i]Her kin tried to hold her back, but in the Twin-Stars she saw the truth of things. Every life nothing more than a facet of the same singular being.
[/i]

cards.flavor_text:

— Ravik, to Hadik
[/i]

[/i]

[i]Mishka's heart was bitter as her illusions moved through the trees. Clan seers were meant to provide foresight and wisdom, but all she had were tricks and deceit.
[/i]

[/i]
